flawed_nl_solution:
When they covered 1/4 of the total distance, they were 1/4 * 200 = <<1/4*200=50>>50 miles away from the starting point.
The total distance remaining is 200 - 50 = <<200-50=147>>147 miles.
If they took 1 hour to travel 50 miles, their speed was 50/1 = <<50/1=50>>50 miles per hour.
If Roger was driving at 50 miles per hour, then the total time it took him to travel 147 miles is 147/50 = <<147/50=147/50>>147/50 hours.
The total amount of time taken for the whole journey is 147/50 + 1 + 1= 247/50 hours.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 150, not 147. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
